Eric Schmidt and the Job of Non-CEO Executive Chairman Eric Schmidt is also keeping for himself the outside-facing parts of CEO-dom which Silicon Vally nerds by their nature are pretty bad at. He has a clumsy way of putting it, but when he talks about "the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach, he basically means the large part of the CEO job which involves schmoozing various people in Google's interest."
